title: [PIP] Markdown version locked to `2.2.0`
body_html: This markdown version lock could cause versioning conflict for downstream (e.g. if requirements are compiled and resolved by pip-compile). Wondering If there's a reason to lock this version. And it's already not sync with the CI install script (those --upgrade with locked version also doesn't seem right to me).
body_text: This markdown version lock could cause versioning conflict for downstream (e.g. if requirements are compiled and resolved by pip-compile). Wondering If there's a reason to lock this version. And it's already not sync with the CI install script (those --upgrade with locked version also doesn't seem right to me).
body: This markdown version lock could cause versioning conflict for downstream (e.g. if requirements are compiled and resolved by pip-compile). Wondering If there's a reason to lock this version. And it's already not sync with the [CI install script](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/install/install_pip_packages.sh) (those `--upgrade` with locked version also doesn't seem right to me).
